data.title: Mamata pays tribute to Nepali poet Bhanubhakta Acharya on birth anniversary
data.meta_description: (This story has not been edited by THE WEEK and is auto-generated from a PTI
data.text:
Kolkata, Jul 13 (PTI) West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Saturday paid tribute to Nepali poet Bhanubhakta Acharya on his birth anniversary.

She said that the poet will always be remembered for his outstanding contribution to Nepali literature and society.

"My heartfelt tribute to Bhanubhakta Acharya, the pioneer poet of Nepali language, on this auspicious occasion of his birth anniversary," she posted on X handle.

"He will always be revered for his outstanding contribution to Nepali literature and society," he said.

Bhanubhakta, a renowned Nepali writer, poet and translator, was best known for translating the epic Ramayana from Sanskrit to Nepali.
